clinical_study.brief_title: Multimodal Imaging Analysis, SD-OCT and OCT Angiography, Retinal Variations Observed in Dialysis Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Multimodal Imaging Analysis, SD-OCT and OCT Angiography, Retinal Variations Observed in Dialysis Patients

brief_summary.textblock:
Little knowledge exist on the short and long-term ophthalmological effect of the dialysis. Some studies stated a variation of the thickness subfoveal choroidal before and after a session of dialyse as well as variations of the coat of optical fibers measured in OCT.
The Optical Coherence Tomography angiography OCT is a not invasive imaging technique which is now a part of examinations of investigation in imaging of retina. This technique allows to study the retinal macula vascularization without injection of contrast agent and thus allows to deepen the knowledge in medical domains where the exploration was to limited because of the invasive character of the examinations.
The hypothesis of this project is that hemodynamic change during the hemodialysis may lead fine variations of the retinal vascularization in the short-term (the day of the dialysis) but also in the longer term (over 1 year).

primary_outcome.description: Analysis of the variation of the vascular densities in retinal macula in the central 6 mm
Analysis of the variation of the vascular densities in retinal macula in the central 6 mm

secondary_outcome.description: Analysis of the variation of the vascular densities in retinal macula in the central 6 mm
Analysis of the variation of the vascular densities in retinal macula in the central 6 mm
Analysis of the variation of the vascular densities in retinal macula in the central 6 mm
Analysis of the variation of the vascular densities in retinal macula in the central 6 mm

secondary_outcome.measure: size of coat retinal optical fibers before dialysis
size of coat retinal optical fibers 1 hour after dialysis
size of coat retinal optical fibers 1 month after dialysis
size of coat retinal optical fibers 3 month after dialysis
size of coat retinal optical fibers 6 month after dialysis
size of coat retinal optical fibers 12 month after dialysis

intervention.description: The patients are seen in consultation ophthalmological before and the 1 hour after their session of dialysis. THE OCT angiography and other not invasive ophthalmological examinations will be realized during the follow-up

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Indication of treatment by hemodialysis
- First session of dialysis
- Hemodialysis planned for 1 minimum year
Exclusion Criteria:
- particular ophthalmological Histories: vitreo-retinal surgery, strong nearsightedness, chronic glaucoma
- Unaffiliated in a national insurance scheme
